alert.note: Alert for Northern Foot Hills; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 23 at 9:20AM MDT until April 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...BLIZZARD TO IMPACT NORTHEAST WYOMING TO NORTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA THIS WEEKEND... .An ongoing robust spring storm will bring heavy snow accumulations and very strong winds this weekend to portions of northeastern Wyoming and northwestern South Dakota, including the northern Black Hills. Heavy snow of 10 to 18 inches is expected across northeast Wyoming, along with northwest wind gusts over 60 mph. Heavy snow and wind gusts to 70 mph are expected across northwest South Dakota. This will result in white out conditions across these areas and the northern Foothills. The northern Black Hills will see significant snowfall of up to 24 inches, with locally higher amounts possible, but winds will be weaker than across the surrounding plains. Very strong northwesterly winds and light snow across portions of the South Dakota plains will result in areas of reduced visibility through Saturday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Sturgis/Piedmont Foot Hills and the Northern Foot Hills. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Foot Hills; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills
